Historical data from the U: S. Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) shows that Wisconsin has been experiencing a downward trend in unemployment since the 2009 financial crisis, with the highest recorded rate being 9.3 percent and the lowest being the current rate of 2.9 percent.
BLS spokesman Gary Steinberg confirms th: 9 percent unemployment rate in Wisconsin is the lowest on record, with data dating back to 1976.
Wisconsin: s Department of Workforce Development reported an increase of 11,400 total non-farm jobs and 19,300 private-sector jobs from February 2018 to February 2019, indicating a positive trend in job growth.
